info.title: EMQ Connect API documentation
info.description:
# Introduction EMQ Connect API allows our partners to create and track money transfers through the EMQ network to any of our payout partners. This document gives a brief overview of the API structure and intended request flow. ## Basic Concepts Every EMQ transfer has a reference, a source, a destination, and an amount: - **Reference**: A unique identifier for this transfer, which you must provide. The reference can be used later to query the transfer status. - **Source**: Describes the original sender of this transfer. Many fields are optional, but providing them may allow us to reduce compliance delays and rejections. We expect basic information such as the sender's name to have been verified by you. - **Destination**: Describes the destination for the transfer. This includes a country (e.g. `PHL`), a payout type (e.g. `cash_pickup` or `bank_account`), and then relevant information depending on those choices (e.g. an account number for a bank account). - **Amount**: When creating a transfer you must provide either a source amount or a destination amount. We will calculate the other side based on our current FX pricing and fees. A newly created transfer is unconfirmed, and will not be processed. The rates and amounts given in the transfer info are guaranteed until the provided expiry time ("expires"). After that time, unconfirmed transfers will be automatically cancelled. Once you [confirm](#operation/confirmTransfer) a transfer, it will processed by EMQ and then sent to our payout partner for delivery. This is a multi-step process, and the transfer query API allows you to track its progress. If there is a problem, such as invalid payout information, we will cancel the transfer and provide a reason. See [GET /transfers/{reference}](#operation/getTransfer) for details. ## Sample API Request Flow The simplest way to use the API is to provide source and destination data inline when creating a transfer. The end-to-end flow then looks something like this: **Notes** - We provide a quote API to query our current FX rate for a given corridor, but this is only for reference and may change at any time. Creating a transfer guarantees its rate if confirmed before its expiry time. - Transfer status can be queried at any time via [GET /transfers/{reference}](#operation/getTransfer). Optionally. you may provide a callback URL and we will POST status updates back to you as they happen. - We may provide a number of status updates for a single transfer. The final update will include a result, indicating whether the transfer succeeded or failed. ## Static Data We provide various lists of static data to use in transfer details, such as available payout methods, lists of banks, and required supporting documentation. See the [/data](#tag/Data) APIs for details. ## Security To secure the communication channel, partner should always verify TLS certificates. We provide two authentication methods, HTTP basic and session token. Please see API reference for details. Please see API reference for details. We also include signature of the API response body signed by our private key in `x-content-signature` response header. Similarly, partner can optionally provide their public key and sign the request body in the same `x-content-signature` request header. If public key is provided, we will verify and reject invalid signatures. The following shows example command to generate private and public key ``` $ openssl genrsa -out priv_key.pem 2048 $ openssl rsa -pubout -in priv_key.pem -out pub_key.pem ``` And the sample code to sign and verify signature in python ``` from Crypto.Signature import PKCS1_v1_5 from Crypto.PublicKey import RSA from Crypto.Hash import MD5 import base64 privKey = RSA.importKey(open('priv.pem').read()) signer = PKCS1_v1_5.new(privKey) msg = u"{}".encode('utf8') digest = MD5.new(msg) sig = signer.sign(digest) sigB64 = base64.b64encode(sig) print("signature: %s" % sigB64) pubKey = RSA.importKey(open('pub.pem').read()) verifier = PKCS1_v1_5.new(pubKey) verified = verifier.verify(digest, sig) print("verified: %s" % verified) ``` These are error reasons for signature related error - `invalid_public_key`: provided public key is not valid RSA public key in PEM format - `missing_signature`: public key is provided but request headers not containing signature - `invalid_signature`: signature verification failed - `invalid_signature_base64`: signature is not correctly encoded in base64 ## API Response and Error Codes ### HTTP status code 400
Reason Message Deatil Description Example
validation_failed Validation failed A list of all invalid data fields, and human-readable reason for validation failure. Data field validation failed. 
{
  "reason": "validation_failed",
  "message": "Validation failed",
  "detail": {
    "data": {
      "account_number": "Invalid format"
    }
  }
}
required_not_provided Missing required fields A list of missed data fields. Required fields are missing in request. 
{
  "reason": "required_not_provided",
  "message": "Missing required fields",
  "detail": {
    "fields": [
      "address"
    ]
  }
}
validation_not_rounded Validation failed Source or destination amount that not correctly rounded. The rounded amount does not validate on check 
{
  "reason": "validation_not_rounded",
  "message": "Validation failed",
  "detail": {
    "destination_amount": "Expected rounded amount"
  }
}
under_limit Under transfer limit N/A Transaction amount under limit. 
{
  "reason": "under_limit",
  "message": "Amount under transfer limit",
  "detail": {}
}
over_limit Over transfer limit N/A Transaction amount over limit. 
{
  "reason": "over_limit",
  "message": "Amount over transfer limit",
  "detail": {}
}
amount_less_than_fees Amount is less then fees N/A Amount less than fee so unable to deduct the fee from amount; only applies to when fee is included in the amount. 
{
  "reason": "amount_less_than_fees",
  "message": "Amount is less then fees",
  "detail": {}
}
duplicate_reference Transfer of the same reference already exists N/A A transfer already existed with the same transfer ID. 
{
  "reason": "duplicate_reference",
  "message": "Transfer of the same reference already exists",
  "detail": {}
}
transfer_not_found Transfer not found N/A The designated transfer ID not found during transfer query or transfer confirm. 
{
  "reason": "transfer_not_found",
  "message": "Transfer not found",
  "detail": {}
}
transfer_expired Transfer has expired N/A The designated transfer already expired after 10 minutes for transfer confirm. 
{
  "reason": "transfer_expired",
  "message": "Transfer has expired",
  "detail": {}
}
invalid_corridor Invalid source or destination country N/A Calling the /statements API with wrong {country} information 
{
  "detail": {},
  "message": "Invalid source or destination country",
  "reason": "invalid_corridor"
}
permission_denied Permission denied N/A Channel in transfer is not matched with the authentication. 
{
  "detail": {},
  "message": "Permission denied",
  "reason": "permission_denied"
}
no_rate No exchange rate available A list of payin & payout currency Transfer query: There's no specified ex-change rate in the system for the input & output currency 
{
  "detail": [
    "usd",
    "cny"
  ],
  "message": "No exchange rate available",
  "reason": "no_rate"
}
fees_exchange_not_supported Currency exchange failed during fees N/A Transfer query: The input & output currency do not match during fees exchange step 
{
  "detail": {},
  "message": "Currency exchange failed during fees",
  "reason": "fees_exchange_not_supported"
}
review_exchange_not_supported Currency exchange failed during review N/A Transfer query: The input & output currency do not match during amlreview step 
{
  "detail": {},
  "message": "Currency exchange failed during review",
  "reason": "review_exchange_not_supported"
}
cash_payin_exchange_not_supported Currency exchange failed during cash payin N/A The input & output currency do not match during cash payin step 
{
  "detail": {},
  "message": "Currency exchange failed during cash payin",
  "reason": "cash_payin_exchange_not_supported"
}
kyc_check_exchange_not_supported Currency exchange failed during KYC check N/A The input & output currency do not match during kyc check step 
{
  "detail": {},
  "message": "Currency exchange failed during KYC check",
  "reason": "kyc_check_exchange_not_supported"
}
transfer_already_confirmed Money transfer already confirmed N/A The transfer is confirmed already 
{
  "detail": {},
  "message": "Money transfer already confirmed",
  "reason": "transfer_already_confirmed"
}
invalid_country invalid_country N/A The {country} is not listed within the pre-configured setting of destination for this partner 
{
  "detail": {},
  "message": "Invalid country",
  "reason": "invalid_country"
}
not_found Target not found N/A May encounter while using Sender API either sender or recipient is not found. 
{
  "detail": {},
  "message": "Target not found",
  "reason": "not_found"
}
### HTTP status code 500
Reason Message Deatil Description Example
internal_error System error, please contact support Any exception happens in core without throwing a proper reason 
{
  "detail": {},
  "message": "System error, please contact support",
  "reason": "internal_error"
}
### HTTP status code 201/200

new unconfirmed N/A N/A This transfer is created and waiting for confirming

review reviewing N/A N/A This transfer is under AML review
payout N/A N/A This transfer is waiting to send to payout partners
payout pending N/A N/A Confirming transfer status with payout partners
payout error Invalid or unknown bank account number N/A
sent sent N/A N/A This transfer has been sent to payout partner
sent sent N/A N/A recipient_status = new This transfer has been sent to payout partner, and pending on recipient KYC
finished paid N/A N/A This transfer has been successfully paid out to recipient.
cancelled cancelled cancelled cancelled Manual cancel request by operations (not available for CHN)
cancelled cancelled error error General payout error.
cancelled expired payin_expired unconfirmed Cancelled due to no confirmation in 10 minutes
cancelled cancelled payout_expired unclaimed Payout expired due to recipient didn't pick up money in time.
cancelled cancelled payout_expired account_not_registered This transaction is cancelled due to recipient didn't finish KYC registration in time.
cancelled cancelled payout_rejected rejected General partner rejection.
cancelled cancelled payout_rejected under_limit Amount under limit and rejected by partner
cancelled cancelled payout_rejected over_limit Amount over limit and rejected by partner
cancelled cancelled payout_rejected invalid_account_name Invalid account name and rejected by partner
cancelled cancelled payout_rejected invalid_account_number Invalid account number and rejected by partner
cancelled cancelled payout_rejected invalid_bank_code Invalid bank code and rejected by partner
cancelled cancelled rejected rejected AML rejected
cancelled cancelled rejected corridor_disabled This transfer is cancelled due to corridor disabled
cancelled cancelled user_request user_request The cancellation raised by pay-in partners
# Transfer Guide Welcome to the EMQ Connect API documentation. Before you jump into coding, please review some important information about EMQ and our API. ## Getting Started 1. **Learn more about EMQ** You can get full details about our products and services via the link below:
https://emq.com/ 1. **Run a test case before processing the API integration** Follow the steps below and you will understand more about our workflow. - Get your credential from EMQ's Business Development or Product Management team - Create a transfer in our Sandbox environment - Check the transfer status, statement report and balance 1. **Understand how to arrive at a successful transaction with the flow chart below** ## Authentication We provide two different Authentication methods: Basic Auth and Session_token. With basic authentication, you will have the base64 `username:password` string in the Authorization header with each request. If you want to do sessions, you can issue a login command, which will return a sessionID cookie and you will have to use that each time you make an API request. Please note that the API session will expire in 24 hours. ## Get Quotes Get the rate from [/quotes](#operation/quotes/retrieve) API with source and destination information. This rate is a reference for the current exchange rate in the market, rates applied to transactions may differ and will be confirmed at the time of the transfer request. Once a transaction is created, the rate you are provided with on the transfer creation response will be locked-in for 10 minutes. You must confirm the transfer request within 10 minutes to use this rate. ## Create Transfer As mentioned in [Introduction](#section/Introduction/Basic-Concepts), we have Reference, Amount, Destination, and Source in API payload which are essential for creating a transfer. There are 4 steps for creating a transfer: - Use the correct payload data based on different destination country in [/transfers/{reference}](#operation/createPhilippinesC2CCashPickupTransfer) - Submit the transfer - Get the rate, fee, reference number in our system and other important information in the response after submission - Confirm the transfer by [/transfers/{reference}/confirm](#operation/confirmTransfer) ## Track Transfer Status Check your transfer status via [/transfers/{reference}](#operation/getTransfer). The full list of transfer statuses and what they mean are in API Response. ## Check Account Statement and Balance Check your account statement and balance to make sure the transaction worked. You can get the statement report for the specified time range by [/statements](#tag/Statements) API. Also, you are able to get available balances for all activated currencies in your account via [/balances](#tag/Balances) ## Before Launching 1. **Checklist for integration** - Have basic retry methods to deal with potential system or network failures. - Use the unique reference number for each transfer request, requests that have been rejected or cancelled must be submitted again with a new reference number. - Understand the foreign exchange rate is determined by the market rate applicable when a transfer request is created. The rate will be kept for 10 minutes and the transaction will be cancelled without confirmation in 10 minutes as well. - Have retrieved every transaction status. - Pull account statement and balance information to your system automatically. - Map the statement information into your accounting system. 2. **Production credential** - Contact our Business Development or Product Management team for the production credential. - Keep the credential safe and limit it to particular operations member(s) 3. **Process a small amount transaction in production** - Pre-fund to EMQ - Communicate with our Business Development or Product Manager and try a few real transactions in production environment. - Cooperate with our team once youre ready for launch when everything seems fine.

get.description: Retrieve list of active corridors.

x-code-samples.source:
import requests, base64, json

endpoint = "https://sandbox-partner.emq.com/v1"

# Replace the following 2 variables with your credentials.
username = "FILL_IN_USERNAME"
password = "FILL_IN_PASSWORD"


api_path = "/data/countries"

url = "{}{}".format(endpoint, api_path)
headers = {"cache-control": "no-cache"}

# =================================
# With Basic Authentication (include authorization for each API call)
encoded = base64.b64encode("{}:{}".format(username, password).encode("ascii"))

headers_with_auth = headers.copy()
headers_with_auth["Authorization"] = "Basic {}".format(encoded.decode("ascii"))

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers_with_auth)
# print(response.text)

post.description:
You will see three states in the response from [Get_Transfer](#operation/getTransfer) API after raising a cancellation:

- When the cancellation is still requesting, you will see `"cancellation_state": "requesting"` under `"info"`
- When the cancellation succeeds, the state of the transaction will turn to `"state": "cancelled"` and the `"reason"` will be `"user_request"`
- When the cancellation fails,  you can see `"cancellation_state": "failed"` under `"info"`.

Please note that the transaction can have other status before being confirmed `"cancelled"`.

allOf.description: Compliance requirements for the China market mean that we cannot accept spaces within the names in this corridor. Names that contain spaces will receive validation errors. e.g. If the recipient's name is **Cool Joe Cooper**, you will have to provide **CoolJoe** to the legal first name and **Cooper** to the legal last name.

If `native_company_name` (which is bank account name in Katakana) is not provided, our service provider will convert for us, but might lead to 50% failure rates. We highly recommend to provide Katakana bank account holder's name.

If `compliance.remittance_purpose`=`008-01`(Goods trade), 3 more fields `product_description`, `origin_of_product`, and `original_shipping_port` are required in `compliance`.

endpoint = "https://sandbox-partner.emq.com/v1"

# Replace the following 2 variables with your credentials.
username = "FILL_IN_USERNAME"
password = "FILL_IN_PASSWORD"

date = "2018-12-10"

api_path = "/statements/daily/{date}".format(**{
  "date": date
})

url = "{}{}".format(endpoint, api_path)
headers = {"cache-control": "no-cache"}

# =================================
# With Basic Authentication (include authorization for each API call)
encoded = base64.b64encode("{}:{}".format(username, password).encode("ascii"))

headers_with_auth = headers.copy()
headers_with_auth["Authorization"] = "Basic {}".format(encoded.decode("ascii"))

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers_with_auth)
# print(response.text)

get.description:
Retrieve the settlement report for a given date and a given destination country. If multiple source countries go to the destination country, the response will combine all the pairs of the source-dest country.

You can also retrieve the settlement report for the given source country, destination country and date, by accessing the following URL: /{sourceCountry}/{destCountry}/{date}

summary.description: The summation of all the transactions

details.description: The details of the transactions of the date

post.description: Verify if a mobile wallet account is on the destination platform. For Africa payouts, it is only available for [eWallet services](#operation/createAfricaC2CEWalletTransfer).

Verify a recipient.

The returned values could be explained differently depending on different payout countries and methods:

**country - China, method - bank_account**
  - HTTP 200: result=ok, indicates that the recipient has completed the first time recipient KYC.
  - HTTP 400: errors, could be caused by either the recipient has NOT completed KYC yet ("account_not_registered"), or the provided card number is invalid ("invalid_account_number").

post.description: Upload a supporting document for a partner sender. This is not a multipart request. The content type should be MIME type for image or PDF, and the body should be the binary data.

x-code-samples.source:
import requests, base64, json
from requests.compat import urljoin

endpoint = "https://sandbox-partner.emq.com/v1/"
api_path = "/documents/{senderRef}/{country}/{set}/{type}.{ext}"

# Replace the following 2 variables with your credentials.
username = "FILL_IN_USERNAME"
password = "FILL_IN_PASSWORD"

sender_ref = "FILL_IN_THE_SENDER_ID_IN_THE_RESPONSE_OF_CREATION"
doc_country = "FILE_IN_DOC_COUNTRY_OF_ISSUE"
doc_set = "FILE_IN_DOC_SET"
doc_type ="FILE_IN_DOC_TYPE"
ext = "FILE_IN_FILE_EXTENSION" #Example: "pdf"

url = urljoin(endpoint, api_path.format(
    **{"senderRef": sender_ref, "country": doc_country, "set": doc_set, "type": doc_type, "ext": ext}))
headers = {
    "cache-control": "no-cache",
    "content-type": "application/pdf" #"image/jpeg" "image/png" "application/pdf"
}
# =================================
# With Basic Authentication (include authorization for each API call)
encoded = base64.b64encode("{}:{}".format(username, password).encode("ascii"))

headers_with_auth = headers.copy()
headers_with_auth["Authorization"] = "Basic {}".format(encoded.decode("ascii"))

response = requests.request("PUT", url, headers=headers_with_auth)
# print(response.text)

Compliance.description: The compliance data for a transfer.

code.description:
The relationship code for this transfer. The relationship name of each code is as below list:
* `"01"` e.g. Beneficiary is [Parents] of the sender
* `"02"` e.g. Beneficiary is [Siblings] of the sender
* `"03"` e.g. Beneficiary is [Other Relatives] of the sender
* `"04"` e.g. Beneficiary is [Vendor] of the sender
* `"05"` e.g. Beneficiary is [Supplier] of the sender
* `"06"` e.g. Beneficiary is [Employee] of the sender
* `"07"` e.g. Beneficiary is [Spouse] of the sender
* `"08"` e.g. Beneficiary is [Friends] of the sender
* `"09"` e.g. Beneficiary is [Employer] of the sender
* `"10"` e.g. Beneficiary is [Child] of the sender
* `"11"` e.g. Beneficiary is the Sender him/her [Self]
* `"99"` please comment with the relation

relation.description: The comment to the relationship name where applicable. Required if code=**"99"**.

shipper.description: Required to state the shipper and consignee while if differently upon goods trade transfers.

state.description:
Transfer status is available at any time. Transfers have a master state which is one of: 
- new: the transfer is not confirmed yet
- held: the payout corridor is currently disabled, usually due to insufficient prefund balance
- review: the transfer is under AML review
- payout: the transfer is waiting for payout
- sent: the transfer has been sent to our payout partner
- finished: the transfer has been successfully paid out to the recipient
- cancelled: the transfer has failed or been cancelled. More detail is provided in the info

info.description: Transfers also have an "info" block containing additional information, depending on their history.

cancellation_state.description: When the cancellation is still requesting or fails, you will see "cancellation_state" under "info".

state.description: Sub-state under the master state, e.g. "unconfirmed", "expired", "unfunded", "rejected", "cancelled".
